div.p: I did not want to let Lord Fabricius leave without my letter to you, so that you would be informed that I have received the letters you gave him, and that you may be assured that the previous ones and what you wrote will be of great concern to me, and I will not overlook anything in them. The Lord usually restrains the insolence and pride of impious men.
You will learn about other matters and those that are being spread in Basel from Lord Fabricius, whom I would have gladly gratified in some matter. Farewell well.
Solothurn, the last day of November.
I greet Mr. Walter and Martyr and commend my son to them.
To Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, the most vigilant pastor of the Church of Zurich. In Zurich.
